meanings.definition: Resembling a line in shape or form.
meanings.sent1: The fence had a linelike design, with straight edges and sharp corners.
meanings.sent2: Her linelike drawing of the tree captured its simplicity and elegance.
meanings.sent3: The linelike pattern on the wallpaper made the room feel organized and neat.
meanings.sent4: His linelike handwriting was so precise, it looked like it was printed.
meanings.sent5: The linelike shadows of the skyscrapers stretched across the street, creating a geometric pattern.

meanings.definition: Having the characteristics of a line.
meanings.sent1: The linelike structure of the bridge made it strong and sturdy.
meanings.sent2: The linelike pattern on the fabric gave it a modern and sleek look.
meanings.sent3: The linelike arrangement of books on the shelf made it easy to find each one.
meanings.sent4: Her linelike logic in solving the puzzle impressed everyone around her.
meanings.sent5: The linelike formation of the dancers on stage created a visually striking performance.

meanings.definition: Having a linear or straight appearance.
meanings.sent1: The linelike path through the garden led straight to the fountain.
meanings.sent2: The linelike structure of the building made it stand out among the rest.
meanings.sent3: The linelike rows of corn in the field looked like soldiers standing in formation.
meanings.sent4: His linelike haircut was so precise, it seemed like it was done with a ruler.
meanings.sent5: The linelike horizon at sunset painted a perfect straight line across the sky.
